page.title: 12LAW AND ORDER IN CURDWORTH
page.content: THE AREA INCLUDING WATER ORTON IS POLICED BY OFFICERS FROM WARWICKSHIRE CONSTABULARY, BASED AT COLESHILL. 1 INSPECTOR AND 3 SERGEANTS ARE BASED AT THE STATION, WITH 3 CONSTABLES PATROLING 16 HOURS A DAY IN 2 SHIFTS. CID AND FAST RESPONSE CARS FOR EMERGENCY 999 CALLS ARE ALSO BASED AT COLESHILL. THE TRAFFIC GROUP IS AT RUGBY AND DOGS AND HANDLERS AT BEDWORTH. AS IT IS A LOW CRIME AREA, THEFT OF AND FROM VEHICLES, BURGLARY AND PETTY THEFT ARE MOST COMMON. THESE ARE DEALT WITH AT COLESHILL MAGISTRATES COURT AND TRAFFIC OFFENCES AT PETTY SESSIONS COURT NUNEATON. LOCAL BEAT OFFICERS ARE FLEXIBLE, VISITING SCHOOLS AND CLUBS, DEALING WITH DOMESTIC MATTERS, VISITING FARMS AND LIASING WITH PARISH COUNCIL. A NEIGHBOURHOOD WATCH SCHEME OPERATES IN THE VILLAGE.
